sentences.sContent: Adam whistled happily on his way to work.
sentences.sCn: 亚当在上班路上愉快地吹着口哨。

sentences.sContent: I heard this song on the radio and I’ve been whistling it all day.
sentences.sCn: 我在收音机里听到这首歌，就吹了一整天这个调子的口哨。

sentences.sContent: He whistled a tune as he strolled down the corridor.
sentences.sCn: 他口里吹着一首曲子沿着走廊缓步走去。

synos.tran: 口哨；[铁路][船]汽笛；啸啸声

remMethod.val: w + hist(嘘) + le → 嘘的一声 → 吹口哨； 口哨

words.tran: 发出哨声的；听起来像哨声的

trans.tranCn: 吹口哨；用口哨吹奏(曲调)
trans.tranOther: to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips
a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it
